review: We own this and a Roku 2 HD box. Between the two, I would take this any day.We watch a lot of educational videos on YouTube and this is a vastly superior interface compared to any other TV centric streaming device I have used. You simply use the video app on your phone as you normally would, but press a button in the app to switch the video content to play on your TV.Setup was a breeze and the price is right. I can't wait to see additional functionality added.The downside is that no remotes are included. You must use a smart phone, tablet, or laptop to control the video. Also, there is still a limited pool of apps that can make use of the device. On my iPhone, I can use Pandora, Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Youtube, but not Amazon Prime streaming video.
author: vamommy

review: I love this thing. I can watch all the shows I want on my HuluPlus and Netflix account. Plus it allows me to stream Chrome tabs from my computer with ease. I will never use cable again!
author: AH

review: I had high hopes for the Chromecast. However, the device is quite slow in loading applications, and it often has trouble syncing with my devices. Now that I have a Smart TV I don't really see the need for this, and you might as well skip out on it as well - unless you're a diehard Googler and your whole life is wrapped up in it. Since mine isn't, I wonder if that's why I had trouble. Perhaps using Google's TV & Movies apps might work better than Netflix and Hulu? Just a thought. I say save your money.
author: Michael Vollbrecht

review: I bought this within a month of the release, and was pleased with the ability to stream Netflix to my TV without using cords from phones or computers.As time has passed, the additions of Pandora and most recently WatchESPN has made this device the center of my living room.  I recently purchased a new cell phone with the Kit Kat update, and even videos from within the Chrome browser on my phone can be cast to my TV.  The functionality of this device is only growing, and this appears to be the future of TV. And for $35!
author: Amazon Customer

review: I SUPPOSE IT DOES WHAT IS SUPPOSE TO DO.  WASN'T QUITE WHAT I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE.  I THOUGHT I WOULD BE ABLE TO ACCESS ALL WEBSITE THROUGH THIS PRODUCT, BUT THAT WASN'T THE CASE. STILL A GOOD PRODUCT, FAST SHIPPING

review: Use this all the time, works very well, just have a computer, smartphone, or tablet nearby. Theres lots of apps in the Play store that have support for this, always something new to try. Try the Doodlecast app with your family and see what I mean.
